issues.title: Discuss with Donald Eastlake and IEEE Co-ordination.
issues.author: wkumari
issues.body:
# Author notes / reminders:
  - We should discuss this proposal with Donald Eastlake ({{I-D.ietf-intarea-rfc7042bis}}) and IEEE coordination.
  - Reference Ravioli draft.
  - Try and remember who all we've discussed this with, and thank them.

comments.author: wkumari
comments.body:
I done created the issue, but then didn't you know, update the issue...

I sent email to Donald on Jen 23rd, and he said he'd have a look.

issues.title: Document title ?
issues.author: evyncke
issues.body:
It is still time to change the I-D title (as well as the file name).

What about "Layer-2 Isolation for Limited Domains" ?

It is more than bikeshedding, IMHO, it does not pretend to be "safer" just "isolated"

comments.author: evyncke
comments.body: Could also be "Layer-2 Fail-Closed via specific EtherType"

comments.author: wkumari
comments.body:
Perhaps.

It does also discuss / introduce the concept of fail-open vs fail-closed.
How about "Fail-Closed Limited Domains" or "Making Limited Domains Fail
Closed"?




On Sun, Feb 04, 2024 at 3:59 PM, Eric Vyncke ***@***.***>
wrote:

> Could also be "Layer-2 Fail-Closed via specific EtherType"
>

pulls.title: Éric's first take
pulls.author: evyncke
pulls.body:
Hi Warren and others,

Just did a first pass over Warren's original draft.

comments.author: evyncke
comments.body: @wkumari would love to see your view on the changes, I have done my first pass and nothing else to add.

comments.author: wkumari
comments.body:
I'm quite bummed by your removal of "We've been trying to reach you about your car's extended warrantee", but I understand that you don't live in the USA (and neither will many readers), and so aren't constantly bombarded with this.... so, a very grudging "Okey" on that. 

Happy smiles on the rest :-P

pulls.title: Add OUI suggestion from Donald. Somehow I managed to lose a bunch of …
pulls.author: wkumari
pulls.body: …text (I forgot to push, and then reverted...), so apologies if I lost anyones text

comments.author: evyncke
comments.body: I agree: the changes look good to me. I especially like the final open discussion and the change from transport to layer-3 limited domains.

reviews.author: sureshkrishnan
reviews.body: Looks good overall, but I think we need some more nuanced text in the security considerations section. The point I would like to emphasize there is that something bad *might* happen if the protocol leaks and the current text does not make it optional. I will submit a PR with a slight change.

comments.body:
```suggestion
Protocols are designated as "limited domain" because something unexpected might happen if
they leak outside of a domain with unified management. For example, VLAN or VPN
```
